title: Gennady Golovkin vs Sergiy Derevyanchenko LIVE: Undercard results, UK start time, TV channel and live stream
text:
Gennady Golovkin will become a two-time middleweight world champion tonight if he beats the dangerous Sergiy Derevyanchenko.

The 37-year-old lost his belts last year when he was controversially beaten by bitter rival Canelo Alvarez in their rematch.

Golovkin then beat Steve Rolls on his return to the ring to set up the chance to add more silverware to his trophy cabinet.

Derevyanchenko has lost just once as a professional in a closely-fought contest with Danny Jacobs and had been due to face Canelo but a deal could not be reached.

Instead he takes on a Golovkin who many feel may be on the slide.

The fight will be streamed live on Sky Sports but you can follow all the action right here with the main event starting at around 4am.
description: Golovkin bids to win back one of his middleweight titles tonight against the once-beaten Derevyanchenko
